result.execSummary:
The defendant Caleb D. Hopkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May have contact with victim only as allowed by agent.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.  May have contact w/ child as allowed by Domestic Relations Court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Caleb D. Hopkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Discharged from probation on 09/29/17
Discharged on 9/29/17
Notice to DNA Collection at Conviction
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Jeremy Chavez.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years on each count concurrent.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  DNA ordered.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Jeremy Chavez.  Atty Chavez reports the documents received from the military were mental health records.  Defense requests another adjournment to attempt to obtain the correct documents; motion denied.  Court decides to proceed to sentencing today.  Atty Chavez is not prepared to proceed today - does not have the PSI with him; in addition, the deft would like his parents present.  Court will grant a short adjournment.  Sentencing hrg adj to 9/29/15 @ 10am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Jeremy Chavez.  Atty Chavez reports he has received about half of the deft's military records; he is expecting the rest of the documents today.  Sentencing adj to 9/25/15 @ 9:45am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Jeremy Chavez.  Defense moves for an adjournment; the deft has requested the military docs and should be receiving them w/in a week a or so.  Sentencing adj to 9/18/15 @ 9am.
email to Judge Schroeder from Probation Agent Nolan

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Jeremy Chavez.  Sentencing hrg adjourned to 8/31/15 @ 2pm.  Court would like add'l information regarding the military contacts.  Court requests the court to contact DOC and request add'l information regarding those police contacts/military records.
Amended Info

Minutes:  15CF33/15CF426.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.

15CF33 - Amended information filed.  Deft pleads guilty to both counts in the amended information; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 7/20/15 @ 2pm.

15CF426 - dismissed on State's motion per plea agreement.
Atty Aileen Henry out due to family emergency; status conf adj to 6/3/15 @ 1:45pm
Status conference on June 3, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Defense moves for an adjournment; attempting to get the deft into Veteran's Court.  Status/possible plea hrg set for 5/18/15 @ 2:45pm

and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA J Krejcarek

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Jeremy Chavez (for Atty Aileen Henry).  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Pretrial adj. to 4/21/15 at 1:15.  JS remains on for 4/27/15 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
Scheduling Order

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Aileen Henry. Clerk LE.  Comm. Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 3-19-15 @ 1:50pm. Jury selection on 4-27-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
